rules: Rule1: If the director is featured on a talk show, then the cast appears in a promotional tour.
Rule2: Whenever the cast appears in a promotional tour, the film wins the box office.
Rule3: Under the condition that the film is reviewed by a major publication, it is featured in an entertainment show.
Rule4: Provided that the film is featured in an entertainment show, it is discussed on a game show.
Rule5: Either the film becomes a cultural phenomenon, or if the film is discussed on a game show, then the film release is successful.
Rule6: Provided that the film production is profitable, the film release is successful.
Rule7: Under the condition that the lead actor wins an award, the film production is profitable.
Rule8: Whenever the film is nominated for an award, it does not receive critical panning.
Rule9: Provided that the film wins the box office, it is not the case that the film receives critical panning.
Rule10: Under the condition that the studio receives funding, the film is nominated for an award.
Rule11: Either the studio receives funding, or the director is featured on a talk show.
Rule12: If it is not the case that if the film generates merchandise revenue, then it does not become a cultural phenomenon, then the film spawns a franchise.
Rule13: Provided that it is not the case that if the film generates merchandise revenue, then it does not become a cultural phenomenon, then it is not the case that the film spawns a franchise.

Rule14: If it is not the case that either the lead actor receives a standing ovation or if it is not the case that the negation of the studio executive greenlighting production implies the studio executive attends the premiere, then the film production is profitable, then the film receives critical panning.

Rule15: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of the studio executive greenlighting production implies the studio executive attends the premiere, the film is reviewed by a major publication.
Rule16: Under the condition that it is not the case that the negation of the studio executive greenlighting production implies the studio executive attends the premiere, the lead actor wins an award.

Rule17: If it is not the case that the negation of the studio executive greenlighting production implies the studio executive attends the premiere, then it is not the case that the film release is successful.
facts: Fact1: The film generates merchandise revenue.
Fact2: It is not the case that the studio executive attends the premiere.
Fact3: The lead actor does not receive a standing ovation.
